data.title: Facebook users would tell social media platform their bank balance for $8.44 a month
data.text: Study of people across six countries finds German users would charge most for sharing personal data

data.title: Facebook acquires the VR game studio behind one of the Rift’s best games
data.text: Facebook is aiming to build on its VR hardware launches of 2019 with an investment in virtual reality software. Facebook announced today that it has acquired Bay Area VR studio Sanzaru Games, the developer of Asgard’s Wrath, considered by many enthusiasts to be one of the Oculus Rift’s best games.

data.title: Big Tech tumbles: Apple, Microsoft, Facebook are in correction territory
data.text: CNBC's Josh Lipton reports on the technology stocks that are in correction territory amid the market sell-off.

data.title: Facebook would have to pay $3.50 per month to U.S. users for sharing contact info: study
data.text: German Facebook  users would want the social media platform to pay them about $8 per month for sharing their contact information, while U.S. users would only seek $3.50, according to a study of how people in various countries value their private information.

data.title: Facebook Aims To Get 3.5 Billion People Online So That It Can Profit From Their Data
data.text: Facebook has published its latest annual Inclusive Internet Index, reporting that even though 4.1 billion individuals are now online across the globe, it still wants to play a key role in connecting the remaining 3.5 billion to the World Wide Web.

data.title: 3 Stocks I'm Buying If the Coronavirus Selloff Gets Worse
data.text: The pullback may be just beginning.

data.title: Mega-Cap Tech Stocks Could Be Hit Hard Since They Are An Easy Source Of Cash
data.text: Portfolio managers will turn to mega-cap tech stocks to raise cash quickly in a turbulent market. PMs probably have large holdings in them and those stock’s liquidity means the additional selling shouldn’t create a downward spiral.

data.title: Facebook invests in diverse array of projects in mission to connect the world
data.text: From beaming internet to rural areas from satellites, to expanding Terragraph and laying fiber, Facebook is toiling away to get everyone connected.
